dt: {bc}the rubbing of one body against another
{bc}the force that resists relative motion between two bodies in contact

dt.t: oil in a car engine reduces {wi}friction{/wi}

dt: {bc}the clashing between two persons or parties of opposed views {bc}{sx|disagreement||}
{bc}sound produced by the movement of air through a narrow constriction in the mouth or glottis

et: earlier, therapeutic rubbing of the limbs, from Middle French, from Latin {it}friction-, frictio{/it}, from {it}fricare{/it} to rub; akin to Latin {it}friare{/it} to crumble, and perhaps to Sanskrit {it}bhrīṇanti{/it} they injure
shortdef: the rubbing of one body against another
the force that resists relative motion between two bodies in contact
the clashing between two persons or parties of opposed views : disagreement

dt: {bc}a clutch in which connection is made through sliding friction

shortdef: a clutch in which connection is made through sliding friction

dt: {bc}a power-transmission system that transmits motion by surface friction instead of teeth

shortdef: a power-transmission system that transmits motion by surface friction instead of teeth

dt: {bc}a usually cloth tape impregnated with water-resistant insulating material and an adhesive and used especially to protect, insulate, and support electrical conductors

shortdef: a usually cloth tape impregnated with water-resistant insulating material and an adhesive and used especially to protect, insulate, and support electrical conductors
